Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Scarab
Description: Rounded scarab found near the right wrist of a child that wore an elephant hair bracelet and that was buried in a wooden coffin. Few anatomical details are depicted. The clypeus is carved with two red crowns opposed on either side of an obscure inscription, typical of the Second Intermediate Period.
